wikipedia_page.main: John Jarvis Broughton (8 September 1873 – 3 April 1952) was an English cricketer active from 1901 to 1914 who played for Lancashire. He was born in Grantham and died in Orrell. He appeared in six first-class matches as a righthanded batsman, scoring 153 runs with a highest score of 99, and held three catches.He was also the originator of JJB Sports

response: John Broughton is an Australian astronomer.
John Broughton or Jack Broughton may also refer to:
*John Broughton (dentist) (born 1947), New Zealand dental and Māori health academic, and playwright
*John Broughton, author of Wikipedia – The Missing Manual
